tweet: @AmeliasBrain @srl295 I think the problem here is there are many flavors of English and some aren‚Äôt familiar with en-US date time. You‚Äôd probably havr to do locale detection to know the right en flavor. And with that comes the correct default hourCycle

name: Long Ho
tweet: @AmeliasBrain I wouldn‚Äôt recommend doing that. Date time formats are based on predefined skeletons that are part of CLDR so things like ‚Äú1/1/2020 at 2:00pm‚Äù works (notice the ‚Äúat‚Äù) across locales. Ideally they should be formatted together

name: Long Ho
tweet: @AmeliasBrain Yes en is basically alias to en-US so ideally you should specify the full locale with region and script
